template.name: Template OS Windows With Total network

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Exceptions(EdgeTransport)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Exceptions(EdgeTransport)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Exceptions(Microsoft.Exchange.RpcClientAccess.Service)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Exceptions(Microsoft.Exchange.RpcClientAccess.Service)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Exceptions(Microsoft.Exchange.Search.ExSearch)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Exceptions(Microsoft.Exchange.Search.ExSearch)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Exceptions(Microsoft.Exchange.ServiceHost)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Exceptions(Microsoft.Exchange.ServiceHost)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Exceptions(MsExchangeFDS)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Exceptions(MsExchangeFDS)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Exceptions(MSExchangeMailSubmission)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Exceptions(MSExchangeMailSubmission)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Exceptions(msexchangerepl)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Exceptions(msexchangerepl)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Exceptions(MSExchangeTransport)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Exceptions(MSExchangeTransport)\# of Exceps Thrown / sec > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Memory(EdgeTransport)\% Time in GC",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Memory(EdgeTransport)\% Time in GC > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Memory(Microsoft.Exchange.RpcClientAccess.Service)\% Time in GC",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Memory(Microsoft.Exchange.RpcClientAccess.Service)\% Time in GC > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Memory(Microsoft.Exchange.Search.ExSearch)\% Time in GC",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Memory(Microsoft.Exchange.Search.ExSearch)\% Time in GC > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Memory(Microsoft.Exchange.ServiceHost)\% Time in GC",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Memory(Microsoft.Exchange.ServiceHost)\% Time in GC > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Memory(MsExchangeFDS)\% Time in GC",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Memory(MsExchangeFDS)\% Time in GC > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Memory(MSExchangeMailSubmission)\% Time in GC",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Memory(MSExchangeMailSubmission)\% Time in GC > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Memory(msexchangerepl)\% Time in GC",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC_MSEXCHANGEREPL})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Memory(msexchangerepl)\% Time in GC > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC_MSEXCHANGEREPL} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\.NET CLR Memory(MSExchangeTransport)\% Time in GC",300].avg(#5)}>({$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC})
trigger.name: .NET CLR Memory(MSExchangeTransport)\% Time in GC > {$NETCLR_TIME_IN_GC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Memory\Available MBytes",300].last()}<({$AVAILABLE_MB})
trigger.name: Available Mbytes on {HOST.NAME} < {$AVAILABLE_MB}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\Long running LDAP operations/Min",60].last()}>({$LONG_RUNNING_LDAP_OPERATIONS})
trigger.name: Long running LDAP operations/Min > {$LONG_RUNNING_LDAP_OPERATIONS} on {HOST.NAME}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Memory\Page Reads/sec",60].avg(#5)}>({$MEMORY_PAGES_READ_SEC})
trigger.name: Memory\Page Reads/sec >{$MEMORY_PAGES_READ_SEC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Memory\Pages/Sec",60].avg(#5)}>({$MEMORY_PAGES_SEC})
trigger.name: Memory\Pages/Sec >{$MEMORY_PAGES_SEC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Memory\Pages Input/sec",60].avg(#5)}>({$MEMORY_INPUT_PAGES_SEC})
trigger.name: Memory\Pages Input/sec > {$MEMORY_INPUT_PAGES_SEC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Memory\Pages Output/sec",60].avg(#5)}>({$MEMORY_OUTPUT_PAGES_SEC})
trigger.name: Memory\Pages Output/sec > {$MEMORY_OUTPUT_PAGES_SEC} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Memory\Transition Pages Repurposed/sec",60].avg(#10)}>({$MEMORY_TRANSITION_PAGES})
trigger.name: Memory\Transition Pages Repurposed/sec > {$MEMORY_TRANSITION_PAGES} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\LDAP Read Time",60].last()}>({$LDAP_READ_TIME})
trigger.name: MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\LDAP Read Time > {$LDAP_READ_TIME} on {HOST.NAME}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\LDAP Searches timed out per minute",60].last()}>({$LDAP_SEARCH_PER_MINUTE} )
trigger.name: MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\LDAP Searches timed out per minute > {$LDAP_SEARCH_PER_MINUTE} on {HOST.NAME}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\MSExchange ADAccess Processes(msexchangerepl)\LDAP Search Time",300].last()}>({$LDAP_SEARCH_TIME})
trigger.name: MSExchange ADAccess Processes(msexchangerepl)\LDAP Search Time > {$LDAP_SEARCH_TIME} on {HOST.NAME}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\MSExchange ADAccess Processes(MSExchangeTransport)\LDAP Search Time",300].last()}>({$LDAP_SEARCH_TIME})
trigger.name: MSExchange ADAccess Processes(MSExchangeTransport)\LDAP Search Time > {$LDAP_SEARCH_TIME} on {HOST.NAME}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\MSExchange ADAccess Processes(STORE.EXE)\LDAP Search Time",300].last()}>({$LDAP_SEARCH_TIME})
trigger.name: MSExchange ADAccess Processes(STORE.EXE)\LDAP Search Time > {$LDAP_SEARCH_TIME} on {HOST.NAME}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Network Interface(*)\Bytes Total/sec",60].last()}>({$MEGABITS_TOTAL_SEC}*1024*1024)
trigger.name: Network Interfaces Total Mbps > {$MEGABITS_TOTAL_SEC} on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: ÐÑÑÐ°Ð¶ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ðµ {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Network Interface(*)\Bytes Total/sec",60].last()} Ð²Ð¾Ð·Ð²ÑÐ°ÑÐ°ÐµÑ Ð·Ð½Ð°ÑÐµÐ½Ð¸Ðµ Ð² Ð±Ð¸ÑÐ°Ñ Ð² ÑÐµÐºÑÐ½Ð´Ñ (bps), Ñ.Ðº. Ð¿ÐµÑÐµÐ²Ð¾Ð´Ð¸ÑÑÑ Ð¸Ð· Ð±Ð°Ð¹Ñ/Ñ Ð² Ð±Ð¸Ñ/Ñ.

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Memory\% Committed Bytes in Use",300].last()}>{$COMMITTED_BYTES_PERCENTAGE}
trigger.name: On {HOST.NAME} %Committed Bytes in Use > {$COMMITTED_BYTES_PERCENTAGE}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Processor(_Total)\% Privileged Time",300].avg(#5)}>({$PROCESSOR_PRIVTIME_PERCENTAGE})
trigger.name: On {HOST.NAME} Processor(_Total)\% Privileged Time > {$PROCESSOR_PRIVTIME_PERCENTAGE} It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time",300].avg(#5)}>({$PROCESSOR_TIME_PERCENTAGE})
trigger.name: On {HOST.NAME} Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time > {$PROCESSOR_TIME_PERCENTAGE}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Processor(_Total)\% User Time",300].avg(#5)}>({$PROCESSOR_USERTIME_PERCENTAGE})
trigger.name: On {HOST.NAME}Processor(_Total)\% User Time > {$PROCESSOR_USERTIME_PERCENTAGE}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\Network Interface(*)\Packets Outbound Errors",60].last()}>({$NETWORK_PACKET_ERRORS})
trigger.name: Packets Outbound Errors on {HOST.NAME} > {$NETWORK_PACKET_ERRORS}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\System\Processor Queue Length",300].last()}>({$PROCESSOR_QUEUE_LENGTH_HIGH})
trigger.name: Processor Queue Length (all instances) > {$PROCESSOR_QUEUE_LENGTH_HIGH} on {HOST.NAME}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template Microsoft Exchange 2010 Microsoft:perf_counter["\System\Processor Queue Length",300].last()}>({$PROCESSOR_QUEUE_LENGTH_WARNING})
trigger.name: Processor Queue Length (all instances) > {$PROCESSOR_QUEUE_LENGTH_WARNING} on {HOST.NAME}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

dependency.name: Processor Queue Length (all instances) > {$PROCESSOR_QUEUE_LENGTH_HIGH} on {HOST.NAME}. It's {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "system", "--item", "Status", "--statusmode", "AttentionLED"].regexp(^{$IBMDS_SYS_LED_HIGH}$)}=1
trigger.name: System {HOST.NAME} attention LEDs are "{ITEM.VALUE}"

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "system", "--item", "Status", "--statusmode", "ResponseTimeAll"].last()}>({$IBMDS_SYS_RESPONSETIME_DISASTER})
trigger.name: System {HOST.NAME} average response time is {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "system", "--item", "Status", "--statusmode", "ResponseTimeAll"].last()}>({$IBMDS_SYS_RESPONSETIME_HIGH})
trigger.name: System {HOST.NAME} average response time is {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "system", "--item", "Status", "--statusmode", "ResponseTimeAll"].last()}>({$IBMDS_SYS_RESPONSETIME_WARNING})
trigger.name: System {HOST.NAME} average response time is {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "system", "--item", "Status", "--statusmode", "ServiceableEvents"].regexp(^{$IBMDS_SYS_SERVEVENTS_WARNING}$)}=1
trigger.name: System {HOST.NAME} serviceable events are "{ITEM.VALUE}"

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "system", "--item", "Status", "--statusmode", "SystemStatus"].regexp(^{$IBMDS_SYS_STATUS_NORMAL}$)}=0
trigger.name: System {HOST.NAME} status is "{ITEM.VALUE}"

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "system", "--item", "Status", "--statusmode", "Temperature"].last()}=({$IBMDS_SYS_TEMPERATURE_DISASTER})
trigger.name: System {HOST.NAME} temperature is {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "system", "--item", "Status", "--statusmode", "Temperature"].last()}>({$IBMDS_SYS_TEMPERATURE_HIGH})
trigger.name: System {HOST.NAME} temperature is {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "system", "--item", "Status", "--statusmode", "Temperature"].last()}>({$IBMDS_SYS_TEMPERATURE_WARNING})
trigger.name: System {HOST.NAME} temperature is {ITEM.VALUE}

trigger.expression: {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "disk", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0 or {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "enclosure", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0 or {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "fcp", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0 or {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "lun", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0 or {Template IBM DS:ibm_ds8000.py["--host", "{HOST.NAME}", "--type", "pool", "--item", "Data"].regexp(^OK$)}=0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} IBM DS data collector error
